titleStmt.title: William A. Warren to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2596

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Louisville Nov. 1861
To His Excellency
Gov. Magoffin

The undersigned respectfully petitions your Excellency to grant him a Commission to act as Notary Public for the County of Jefferson, and pledges his fidelity to the faithful discharge of the duties appertaining to the office

We know Wm A Warner, the above applicant, and cheerfully recommend your Excellency to grant his petition; being perfectly satisfied that he will faithfully truly and honestly discharge the duties of Notary Public.

Hite & Small
Brent. Hopkins
Mark & Downs
A V duPont & Co
Morris & Hogg
Kitts & Werne
A Craig

Jefferson Co
Notary
Wm A. Warner
Issd. Nov. 18. 1861
